tp:treatment-sec.p:
Comments . Zelurus ochripennis
was described based on a female from “Brasilia” ( Brazil ), without mentioning where it had been collected in this country (1854, 1872). In the NHRS there is a female labeled as “typus” (catalog number NHRS-GULI000008031; Figs. 1–4 ). Because the original description ( Stål 1854 ) did not designate a holotype
, it is better to consider it as a syntype .

The specimens examined here ( Figs. 11–15 , 25 ) generally agree with the previous descriptions and diagnosis of Z. ochripennis ( Stål 1854 , 1869 , 1872 ; Costa Lima, 1940 ) and with its female syntype deposited in NHRS ( Figs. 1–4 ), confirming their identification as belonging to this species.

Material examined. Zelurus ochripennis ( Stål, 1854 ) .

tp:treatment-sec.p: Testicular morphology and cytogenetics analysis. The testes of the examined specimens were elongated with a yellowish testicular peritoneal sheath ( Fig. 16 ). Cytogenetic analysis of meiotic metaphases 1 revealed that Z. ochripennis has a karyotype 2n = 22 (20A + XY) ( Fig. 17 , A–B).

caption.p: FIGURES 16–17. Zelurus ochripennis ( Stål, 1854 ) , male. 16, testis, lateral view, scale bar 1.0 mm, 17, metaphase 1 with ten pairs of autosomes and a pair of sexual chromosomes of two different cells (A–B), indicated respectively by letters X and Y. Karyotype 2n = 22 (20A + XY). Scale bar 10 µm.

tp:treatment-sec.p: Distribution. Brazil , in the States of Minas Gerais , Rio de Janeiro and Espírito Santo (caves, tropical Atlantic moist forest).
